snippet: President Obama praised an Irving high school freshman’s interest in science after his arrest raised questions of bias toward a Muslim student who happens to love tinkering.
abstract: Pres Obama invites student Ahmed Mohamed to White House two days after he is accused of making fake bomb and suspended from Irving, Tex, high school to which he brought homemade alarm clock; Mohamed has become center of debate over whether he had been targeted because of his name and religion.

byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and CHRISTINE HAUSER
byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Houston, and Christine Hauser from New York. Peter Baker contributed reporting from Washington; Patrick McGee from Irving, Tex.; and Ashley Southall from New York.

lead_paragraph: President Obama praised an Irving high school freshman’s interest in science after his arrest raised questions of bias toward a Muslim student who happens to love tinkering.

headline.main: Handcuffed for Making Clock, Ahmed Mohamed, 14, Wins Time With Obama
headline.print_headline: Handcuffed for Making Clock, Youth Gets Time With Obama
